name: Gavin Rossiter
about: I have spent most of my career as a systems software engineer working in air traffic management.
I'm part of a team of 30, responsible for delivering the controller facing applications for a next gen air traffic system.
At home I spend almost every waking hour either studying deep learning & artificial intelligence or working on personal projects such as this website.
I'm particularly interested in artificial intelligence and the relationship humans form with it.
AI is already significantly disrupting the way we live our lives and do business.
How we address this disruption both technically and socially will have a massive impact on our society.
For this reason, it is my goal to help humanity build a safe and symbiotic relationship with AI.
In my next role I want to leverage my software and math skills and passion for AI to solve problems in an AI oriented domain.
The perfect role for me will focus on creating value for society through either the development of a great AI product/service or reaserch into improved AI algorithms/systems.
If you are looking for someone with these traits to fill a role in AI please check out my CV linked above and reach out.

projects.title: Website
projects.description: I designed and built my website with React, TypeScript and Material-UI.

projects.title: Layout web app
projects.description: In addition to my main landing page, I made a toy app to learn React and get back into web programming.

projects.title: Arty
projects.description: Command line based browser and artifact downloader for jenkins built with Rust

projects.title: Spiritlevel
projects.description: Small drink value calculator app built with Flutter

projects.title: Jetpack - Attack of the Space Worms
projects.description: Mobile game developed for final year industry partner project

projects.title: Virus characterization via serial x-ray diffraction: A computational feasibility study
projects.description: Computational simulation of virus characterization via x-ray diffraction using MATLAB.

projects.title: Piecewise linear periodic maps of the plane with integer coefficients
projects.description: Investigation into the behaviour of a particular piecewise periodic linear map and its relation to the crystallographic restriction theorem

summary: I consider myself a polyglot developer with experience in a broad range languages.
I find it easy to pick up a less familar language and can be productive with it quite quickly.
I can code in Java in my sleep, this is my daily driver at work.
Python and TypeScript are my favorite languages for personal projects, they are just so practical and have great libraries.
I feel quite comfortable writing Bash shell scripts and in general I feel that I have good knowledge of the Unix ecosystem.
Recently I learnt some Rust, it was my first serious go (outside of uni) at really low level systems programming and it taught me a lot.
I know some C/C++ and have written some small C programs at work for low level tasks e.g. interacting with OS processes and windowing systems.
I'm a decent web programmer, most of the work I have done in web is aligned more towards single page realtime applications.
strengths: Solid understanding of the balance between pragmatism and quality in software.
Experience in complex, realtime, mission and safety critical systems.
Passionate about software and AI, always working on projects outside of work to improve my skills.
Broad set of software skills, from low level bit twiddling to high level scripts, can do basically anything.
Drive to change the world for the better.
weaknesses: I try my best to know what I do not know.
I'm know that I'm lacking experience in serverless, containerization, modern back end web tech and embedded systems.
e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Microservices, AWS, GCP, Azure, Big Data platforms.
I have a cursory understanding of all of these, and have either done at least one tutorial or read the docs.
I just haven't had the chance to work with them on more than a personal level.
